name: Gems of War - Puzzle RPG
description: From the creators of Puzzle Quest, play the new Puzzle/RPG/Strategy mash-up, GEMS OF WAR! Match gems to power your spells, and match skulls to smite your enemies! It’s easy to learn yet has tons of depth.
minimum_requirements: OS: Vista SP1+, Windows 7 or higher Processor: 2.33 GHz or faster x86 CPU, or Intel Atom 1.6Hz or faster CPU (SSE2 instruction set support) Memory: 1 GB RAM Graphics: Radeon HD2000 series or better, GeForce 8 series or better, Intel 3000 or better (Pixel Shader 4 support required) DirectX: Version 10 Network: Broadband Internet connection Storage: 800 MB available space Sound Card: Required
recommended_requirements: OS: Windows 7 or higher Processor: 2.33 GHz or faster x86 CPU, or Intel Atom 1.6Hz or faster CPU (SSE2 instruction set support) Memory: 2 GB RAM Graphics: Radeon HD5000 series or better, GeForce GTX400 series or better, Intel 3000 or better (Pixel Shader 4 support required) DirectX: Version 11 Network: Broadband Internet connection Storage: 1 GB available space Sound Card: Required

reviews.review_text: Gems of War is a match-3 game with RPG and card collecting elements. If you've enjoyed the Puzzle Quest games, then this one is up your alley. It's free to play and even with the Gold 'energy system', it's still a blast to play without having to spend a dime.     Your team consists of 4 members which is usually your hero and 3 other Troop cards.    Troops  can be earned from Iron Keys (random chance, 1000 gold, guild tasks) or Magic Keys (real money).   Troops level up by enchanting them with  Souls . Max level as of now is level 10.   Souls are gained by killing enemy Troops, completing Kingdom challenges, disenchanting duplicate Troop cards, PVP rewards, and guild tasks.    For every Kingdom quest line that you complete, you are awarded with the Epic card for that kingdom so no need to spend money on Magic Keys unless you really want a chance at those Legendaries.  Things will start out a bit slow since you only have 1 Kingdom and a basic team but hang in there. Once you unlock more kingdoms and join a guild, Iron Keys will become frequent and gold won't seem like a huge deal.  Read on for more tips on Gold and maximizing it.  WARNING  wall-o-text inc.  In Gems, Gold is used to initiate battles and unlock new kingdoms. Each unlocked kingdom will produce Gold for you if you complete up to a certain point in their quest lines, however, you can set one kingdom as your home kingdom to give you bonus gold and mana. Your home kingdom will produce for you 500 gold per 24 hours, or 525 gold if you completed the quest line for it.  If you log in once a day, you will receive a daily log in bonus. The bonus begins at 50 gold and then maxes out at 300 gold. The day resets at 7pm EST/6pm CST.  Gems also runs PVP events that will rotate every 2 weeks. So far, the events give you an additional 200 gold per day.  My recommendation is to join a guild. The guild will give you an initial daily gold bonus of 5% and of course, the percentage bonus will be higher the higher ranked the guild is.  This is what it looks like so far on a Day 7+ log in with one completed kingdom:    Home Kingdom: 525 gold    Day 7+ Daily Bonus: 300 gold   PVP Event: 200 gold   Guild Bonus (5% to daily): 25 gold    Total:  1050 gold / 24 hours for just logging in  Other ways to maximize Gold is to play smart. Matching 4 or 5-in-a-row will give you 4 gold and 5 gold respectively. If you are decent at match-3 games and setting up moves for those 4 & 5-matches, you will seldom, if not never, run out of Gold. Out of my playtime on Gems, I have yet run out of Gold once.  There are also several Troop cards that give you Gold as their ability such as the Alchemist:   Alchemist   Transform a selected Mana color to Yellow. Gain [3+Magic] Gold.   At Level 10, he will give you 8 Gold and then you can choose a color to change to yellow and net yourself easy 4 or 5-in-a-row matches.  Tip: The maximum gold you can earn per battle from Troop skills and 4 & 5-matches is  105 gold .  With Troops like the Alchemist, you can come out of a battle hitting the 105 gold cap easily. And when battles cost 50 gold - 80 gold, you've made profit every battle.  The biggest gold costs are unlocking kingdoms. It costs 250 gold to unlock your first kingdom and then every kingdom after that costs 250 gold extra (e.g. 500, 750, 1000, etc). There's really no way to lessen the blow so just save up :)

*Edited to shorten this up a bit.*  Pros: -Bejeweled-styled gameplay mixed with RPG >> love it. -Card collecting >> love it. And cards are quite upgradable (up to lvl 15) -Lots of great, short stories throughout the game. Quick plots (nothing too special) and awesome characters. -New cards come out roughly every 10 days that are fairly accessable. Special cards come out that require diamonds to be saved up or bought every month or so. -Having enough gold is not really an issue, despite other reports.  Cons: -No 'easy view' or battle chat, and is limited to one short sentence at a time... -No true PvP.  All in all: -Expect a normal, mini-transation Facebook MMO. But it's still quite playable free. 7.5/10

Although this game lack of energy system and consume gold instead when playing the game.  The game is not p2w and p2p.   Gems of War is a mixture of Puzzle Kingdom and Puzzle Quest by the original creator. I never spend any cent on this game, yet I am the 1 of the top 4th guild. This may sounds bad for the developer. If you pay money in this game, the only different is you get increased chance to get better monster than those who do not pay.  I don't have Legendary monster, but Rare monster are good enough.   In other puzzle RPG like Tower Of Savior and Puzzle & Dragon, enemies attack you with multiple turn 'CD'. But in this game, everyone is playing a same rule.  Most important is monster synergy and color.   Rememeber how you play PQ1 by customizing skillset with balance mana? It is here. The only thing that lack from PQ1 is crafting/mount/puzzle mode but it is irrelevent in 'Gems Of War'  Fans of Puzzle RPG. It is time to rejoice.
Free casual game, have fun! but my coins not enough for more play XD

Gems of War is free to play and many of the cards obtainable only from ingame earned currency so you need to play and can not buy with money. The developers have made the game so you can buy with crystals if you are patient everything. Also I have obtained 2 legendaries from silver keys and a joining a guild after level 25 is worth your time as the people donate more gold and you usually get at least 18 silver keys and 30 crystals each week. The game is progression based and you can earn higher level cards by farming souls such as using the valkyre and brian the lucky cards together (60 souls cap per battle).  I do prefer this free to play style game where waiting will get you everything slowly vs other companies using a clear abuse of paying to win tactic you can never obtain paid content/rewards - these games I refuse to play. I will always donate some money for the developers as they are fairer than other companies. I play divination fields challenge 1 over and over to progress now i have finished all the stories. This game can be linked to your phone so you can play in your lunch break or even walking or to relax. I have never run out of gold and PVP rank does not drop if you lose matches so you do not go backwards. Thumbs up from me for a fun Gem match RPG game and other puzzle quest games.

If you enjoy match-3 gameplay or previous puzzle quest titles, there is a lot to enjoy here. It's not too grindy, and while there is a PTW element, you can avoid it and do quite well playing completely for free. I did purchase a $30 pack after 25+ gameplay hours, partially for the rewards, and partially to give back to a dev that created a game that I really enjoy playing.
Match3 + RPG + Strategy can be very addictive, and for me this game is the best one of that mash-up genre.

Simply put, one of the best games EVER created; not because It is free either. I have not put 1 cent into this game and yet I have not been held back at all. They are constantly improving it and adding features. It is now my most played game on steam in over 6 years. I do not know what else to say. Great Game guys!!!

the games mechanics are like a heap of other classic games with a lot of extra stuff like multiplayer.sure, you need to pay the in game curency to play but this makes it so you cant play this game 24/7. so while you wait, why not read a book? or go outside and do something?

I can't understand the negative reviews..at all.. I play this as a casual timekiller on both Steam and my tablet and it's a fun and tactic puzzlegame with a rpg twist where you need a bit of luck as well as some thought into it before making your move.  (You can link your account on Steam to portable device or vice versa, not having to play 2 different games)  As all free games they need to get money from somewhere, in this case as in all other games..a shop to buy crap in. I still havent bought anything in that shop..nor will i ever..can't really see the need to. (possibly will, to support further development of the game though) Most fun is that most of the negative reviews have hundreds of gamehours,,but still they won't recomend it ^^ That's like eating the Pizza AND the box it came in and then tell everyone how bad the Pizza was. *nom nom nom* So obviously the game is a bit fun,,even if it's bad ;)  Nah...download the game..try it.. See for your self, it's all in the eye of the beholder what's fun or not. If it's not your cup of tea,,uninstall and move on,,it's that easy :)

The core mechanic of 'cards with competitive match 3 board as a mana source' might not be on par with deeper games but still sufficiently complex to not feel mindless. And quite a lot is built around that core to make the experience diverse and entertaining for hours.  Just try it. Personally, I was quite surprised that I ended up to like it that much.   And a side note regarding PvP critics in the recent reviews.  Yes, you play vs AI but you still compete against real person's team composition and progression/level.  Using AI have benefits of instant and fast paced(but without turn time limits for you) matches.  I don't think providing a real opponent would add much for a game with half-casual mechanic. This is not MtG/Hearthstone.
A very addicting game, and good to see the regular updates. I like games with developers that care and continue work on them.
Its free, get it.
Started playing the game because it had one playfire reward.Can't stop playing it. 11/10 would play it instead of doing something constructive

Very addictive game. Similar to puzzle quest. Not really pay to win, more like pay to speed up card collecting. In PvP you play against other peoples deck/team controlled by AI. Lots of different things to do.

I like match 3s and this has one of the better combat system. The gems are color blind friendly, and there is a good degree of freedom to customise your team. It is a free to play with an energy sytem in the form of gold, so if you want to play more than 45 min a pop and unlock new packs of cards at a quick rate be prepared to pay. I have not tried too much pvp, but I can imagene that if you wanted to get up high in the ranks it will cost you some real world money. I can forsee hitting a wall where it could stop being fun once I have completed the story quests and their challanges, since they are not repetable, but until then it should be some good old match 3 fun,  Edit: Tried PVP, and I have not ran into any limitations by my not playing money. Playing PVP you get more gold than you spend per round, so you could play till your eyes bled without having to worry about running out of gold. The Devs plan weekly or by weekly events to keep things fresh, so I do not think I will run out of content any time soon.

Gems of War is a strategy based game, with plenty to do.  The main objective of the game is to match gems to attack oponents (CG or PVP) however there is more to do than this, which is what I find sets it apart from almost all other similar style games.   There are specialities, which focus on which gems give extra mana (which allows you to use special moves quicker) You can also gain souls, which are used to level up your characters. With hundreds, if not thousands of different characters with different abilities and majoring in different gem colours, there are so many combinations to create to make your team all-powerful.   Guilds are also an increasing important role (ahem, mines is 'WARMACHIN3'). Guild participation allows for additional keys for treasure chests (these give characters, as well as other cool stuff), gold (this helps progress to other areas), souls (help with levelling characters), diamonds (good for buying new armour)and maps (allow you to gain extra loot)  In order to go into every detail of the game I would be writing for a long time, there is plenty to do and hold your interest. The only downside I've seen is that it kind of throws you in, and you need to discover a lot yourself, but that's not major as it's pretty easy to get the hang of it. I've been playing aound 50 hours and I'm nowhere near close to halfway through. In my opinion it's well worth the time and effort, and has quickly become one of my favourite games.
Really, really, good.
Nice little change on a old fav :) Its in basic a RPGish Match Three Game! If you like Match 3 games try this very casual game !

TL;DR version: Hesitant yes, if you're an intelligent player that paces their games. A no if you're a one-sitting gorger.  As far as a game goes, I find it a nice and interesting take on the Puzzle Quest concept. The art is clean, the mechanics are smooth, and things are for the most part labeled as they should. It's still a question of how much mana of a color you need for a certain card, but considering it's fairly recently come out it's not that big of a gripe though.  In regards to the reviews of 'Getting stuck after 4 hours' because of coins and souls, I have to say this: There's more to this game than the storyline.  In regards to coins: Yes, you only get 500/day, and battles do cost 50-60 coins apiece, but this is to try to help you limit your playtime. You're not supposed to gorge on video games for 12+ hours at a time. The game does seem to be formatted like a mobile game, and one of the logos on the title splash IS a mobile department. So the micropayments for additional playtime/content seems normal, yet I haven't spent a dime on the game and am having fun.  In regards to souls: Don't hoard cards. Look through what you have, chuck the crap for souls. Along with this, also do Challenges. Broken Spire's Stone Wall and Fortress Siege can be done really easy with a lot of cheese tactics, and they give large amounts of souls for completing them. So it'd be a win-win, no?  The one gripe I have, and is starting to become a wall for me, is the RNG in the game. Far far far FAR too often will gems fall perfectly for the AI to combo off of (since 4+ strings give an extra turn), or will drop down skulls at the perfect placement for them to push them into damage. It's almost too coincidental, and feels more like fluff difficulty than an actual challenge, which without this luck of the draw for the AI, would be a general pushover.

Very addicting game for those who like match 3. Keeps you intertained for hours was a little sceptical of the pvp part of the game but it is fun and keeps you wanting to try harder for your achievments

An addictive Puzzle Quest-like game made by the same devs that I have sunk several hundred, almost a thousand hours into now. Early game is a bit rocky but once you get going, there is meaningful experience through the early-mid, mid, and early-late game in both PvP and other modes.   Don't like PvP? Don't worry, Gems uses an AI to control player-made teams that you can set to defend for you and go against whenever you please. Gems is fairly well balanced, with a couple VERY powerful troop combinations, but it is possible to make anything viable for as far in as I have played.   Would I recommend this game? Hell yes. And I have, and I've gotten several friends playing now as well and they love it, too. So jump on in and give it a try. It's free, so the only thing you stand to lose if you don't love it is a bit of your time.  Oh, and as a final note, the developers are incredibly awesome and come on from time to time to talk with the players. They take feedback into consideration and have a fairly transparent design process and are open to discuss anything from in-game topics to daily life with anyone. Wonderful dev team to match this wonderful game.

Great game for those times when you dont feel like playing more brain intensive games. Its still somewhat in need of improvements, like clearer explanations or a better tutorial, but i think the devs will work on making it better over time.   Be wary that it will often happen that the AI will look as a cheater or too lucky (i often swear when playing, lol) but it doesnt detract too much from the fun, just be prepared to get angry from time to time :-)
I like this game so much! hope puzzle quest 2 would be like this..

Pros:  -Great variety of cards -really nice artwork -nice overall mechanics  Cons: -the devs instead of balancing the cards make some op (very rare cards,which you can get if you are extremely lucky or buy keys out of the game....with real money...) and some cards,which you get from gameplay - very lame. -really easy to rage quit and rage out on a fight, because the opponent either bought an OP weapon with real money or just had so much souls (which if you don't have time to enter fights,you can buy with money) with which they upgraded to the max 4 legendary cards... -really interesting that you can see so many people on low levels that have 4 legendary cards (you have 4 card slots and legendary cards less than 1 percent chance to pop up from a key) and also very interesting fact how easily people can exploit bugs in the game   Overall: I'm giving a good review only because I had very good memories with the game in the beginning,you know, when the devs didn't get money hungry as ♥♥♥♥ and the game had some balance. If you want to try it out go ahead you will have fun moments,but as of now I just refuse to rage out on pvp in which people can buy the win.
Just try it already!

I wont say I'm the biggest of match-3 fans, but theres a special place in my heart for Puzzle Quest. While its not the same, it certainly hits that same itch! Big fan of the RPG mechanics, but even bigger fan of the treasure maps. Seriously, those treasure maps are the best!
This game is pretty addicting. I used to play on my tablet, but now that it's on pc i'll be playing a lot.

Absolutely brilliant game, its a mix.... War, strategy and puzzle. Wish I could make it more personal with my character. But I love this game and am more adicted to it than my other game right now, ECHO.
it's a nice game
Nice game.
This is an excellent free-to-play game. There is no pay wall, and if you enjoyed the Puzzle Quest games, you will love this, too.
nice and fun game but after a while it gets boring...also if you want to make real progress you need to invest some cash..if you dont have anything else to do it worth a try..

The luck for ai needs to be trunned down.. Seven extra truns in a row plus skulls appering when they need to for free hits is a bit much.. otherwise a pretty fun game no matter what always look ahead two to sometimes three truns..

This is a pretty fun game which reminds me a lot about another great game called 'Puzzle Quest' of which i played and replayed so much i even lost count~ xP I've seem many bad(and unfair) reviews about this game so i decided to review it in hopes of getting more people to play it and hopefully also have a lot of fun just like me~ :3  This is a free game,so obviously the dev/devs added stuff you can buy with real money,which if you aren't a completionist(is that a real word?),then it is no problem since if you are always a step ahead,be patient,hope for the best and enjoy the challenges,you can and you will win against all odds.  Many complain about the AI cheating,maybe they were unlucky or maybe they played badly and decided to put the blame on the AI cheating,whatever the case,in most,if not all the games in the world the AIs will always cheat,if they didn't it wouldn't be fun for us players,there would be no challenge and nothing to make us want to play,win and replay again with different tactics.  EDIT: It seems that many people also either don't know how to play and blame it on the 'it's pay-to-win!' and review it negatively or as i said before 'maybe' they are simply the unluckiest people to play this kind of game~ :P I haven't paid anything with real money yet and i am currently on level 50,beaten many players who paid for stuff and all done with a little bit of effort and patience. Also for some reason a level 189 managed to attack me(usually the system give us players with max 10 levels of difference to attack),with all stats and monster levels on max (15 for now) and i won,despite thinking i would lose~ :DD

Fun game that pushes you to expand your strategic overview. It takes some time getting used to but if you want to develop yourself you cant just keep on clicking random. Look at all the possibilities and what will happen if you take a step

This was my original review of this game, and I had recommended it to others: 'Fun game--great to relax to. No need to buy extras unless you really want to. In early play in the game it costs more to play than you 'earn' by winning, but play through and soon earning plenty to play and get extras.'  Now, I no longer recommend this game to others, and although I still play some, I am very close to quitting. Here are just a few of my thoughts:  So far, I do not like anything about this new update. The previous update was a degradation of the game, but this one has taken the game to a point where I feel like I am 'slogging through' an unpleasant experience rather than enjoying an engaging fun game. When I started playing the game it was relatively easy to understand the play and logic, and it was a nice way to relax after a day of work. It took some thought and strategizing to improve your game, building teams for different purposes and using them to advantage under differing circumstances. Leveling up is now too complicated, and even the 'buying' rewards with earned glory or gems, etc, has now essentially become so complcated or expensive (seemingly targeted at the pay to play audience), I no longer have incentive to play enough to 'earn' enough to buy a reward of armour, additional character or new weapon.  Now everything that was relaxing and casual (and fun) about the game has been taken away or changed. I have previously recommended this game to others, however, do not believe will do so again. The last update seemed geared towards smart phone or tablet users, and the appearance of the cards/characters changed significantly. Most of the character/card appearance updates were not positive.   Please bring back the original game as it was--roll back to a couple of updates ago and release it as a 'version 1' or 'classic'. I did like the addition of new kingdoms, rewards, arena, and maps. It would have been better to have rolled out a different version ('gold' or 'championship' or even as simple as 'gems of war 2') to make these changes, rather than so drastically altering the play of what had been a very fun, enjoyable and relaxing game.

The longer Gems of War is played, the more it cheats. Not the actual A.I. routines mind you, but the gem drops. At first the drops are manipulated to slightly benefit new players, but as you rank up they heavily favor the A.I. opponents.  If this wasn't a 'free to play' game searching for 'whales', it probably would have been better balanced and satisfying. Even though I'll continue to play, I won't encourage this kind of phone/tablet philosophy with 'micro transactions'. The developers should design a better game and charge a reasonable price. I recommend Puzzle Quest 1, since it's still the best game from this sub-genre (match 3 RPG) I've ever played.  Edit-  While my comments were accurate at the time of my initial review, I feel that the obvious 'cheating' mentioned above had been addressed awhile ago. This is not a deep game, but I keep playing.

basically this game is bejewaled's long lost cousins child after he slept with a card game.  match the colors, match skulls, get points, and then cast spells to win.   simple but its easy to just create a deck of cards that is just unstoppable. and in order to reach the top you have to have a very active clan to max out and buy everything. and if you miss one day of paying your taxes to help the clan, OH LORD HAVE MERCY AND BE KICKED..... sorry? I have a life.  still fun though. i give it a 5/10 to pass the time.

First of all: this game doesn't deserve all the negative reviews. It's a very intriguing mix between a basic match-3 combo game and a card game, where you create your own team.  I want to highlight what I like about Gems of War:     Lots of different units with unique spells and attack moves make for endless team constellations that you can try out.    You don't to spend real money  at all . Simply because you don't need the cash items to enjoy the game and moreover there is a way to get small amounts of cash currency in the game, so you can save up.    The unit design is beautiful. All kinds of fantasy creatures and heroes - check it out.    There are many things to do and you can create a guild with your friends and work on goals together.    It's very good if you only have small time windows for some casual playing - you can easily play 1-2 rounds and make progress in 10-15 minutes without having to invest hours at once.    The new update brought plenty of new features including harder difficulties for extra challenging gameplay.   Big fat recommendation!  10/10
So relaxing and competitive in the same time , love it, it needs some updates but it s pretty good ^^

This game is more than just cards and more than just match 3-- the more time and effort you put into it, the more fun it is. If you are a fan of puzzles and team building strategies, this will give you hours of enjoyment.
this game is awsome

Great free to play casual game, rewards for login bonuses mean you dont NEED to spend money to advance quicker (though it will obviously help) Good fun, especially for those who are into the puzzle quest series

I really like this game. The puzzling is addictive and the different units you encounter give every battle its own unique flavor  I see two common complaints about this game: 1- You have to pay real money to win. This is NOT true. You can easily get a good unit from the free key drops and if you think about how to put your best line-up out there you can definately beat someone with 3 legendary troops. I spent a lot of time just winning P2P with a common troop (goblin) in my line-up. 2- You can only play 10 minutes a day because you run out of gold to pay for your battles. Also NOT true. Just win some matches at P2P and gain enough gold to keep playing for as long as you'd llike.  Highly reccommended game, IMHO.
Nothing like another freemium game... At any rate, this is not a bad sort-of-sequel to Puzzle Quest.

This a Great game, really. It not easy to play. I must admit you need lots of luck to play this. Talk about the gold, if you play everyday upto 7 days you can earn up to 750+ gold more, try to win some PvP game, it does cost 50~80 gold per match but you can earn back 30~50 gold per match (50 gold per match is a badass enemy). My advice? Don't buy keys, you can earn them just by matching those gems.   Defend you kingdom does gain gold, it cost you 50 gold to get around 30~60 gold, easy money. By the way you can get EPIC cards , i repeat EPIC CARDS just by unlock the kingdom and finish all it quest. By finish all the challenge you can earn 100 souls, enough to upgrade the hell out og your troop up to max Level. Thsoe challenge are nothing, it super easy.  For those who said this game not good, I feel sad for them. It a good game for great mind. Just don't play it when you have a bad day. You might fall in a losing chain instead of winning chain. It like playing chess, you move one gem wrong , you dead.  After 45 hours of playing I now have a great deck without paying any real money. Totaly a free game, only those who want to be OP fast in this game, pay their money :v
Your standard Bejeweled type game with a twist. It's easy to pick up and play for a short break, but hard to put down. Highly recommended.
This game playes like a mix of gem crusher and kingdoms. Pretty good for a little time waster.

I love this game. It's an attack match three. Most match threes can become tedious overtime, but this game really has a diversity that keeps me hooked. I even play it on multiple platforms.   Unlike most attack match three games, building the strongest team isn't just about leveling up. I recently decided to switch around my teams and went from a team with attack power over 4,000 to one under 3,000, but was doing better just because the team worked better together.  You can join a guild which allows you to connect with other players, but also to increase your daily earnings. The other thing that keeps it fresh for me, is if I ever get bored of battling, I can just relax and play a treasure map which is all about making big matches to earn gold, glory, keys, and traitstones. There's no way to lose your rewards so it really is stress free and a nice break.

This game is sooo fun its unreal.... if you like the mechanics of puzzle quest you will love this game..... oh and multiplay is not broken like soo many other games on steam and purchases are made ingame through your steam wallet.... you can pay and get like keys or gold or different costumes which are superficial cause if you play you get those things anyways...   peace out
good game i loved it very fun and easy its like ccg game but better

It's highly addictive and fun. You can create countless teams of 4 troops that interacts and plays differently. You can play casual, for your simple pleasure, at your pace. You can try to rank yourself on top of the weekly leaderbords. You simply can have a collector's soul and just wanting a copy of each cards. Oh and by the way, the game is free and totally not pay-to-win, and even less pay-to-play. The game is very generous and gives you rewards at each play.
I don't get why people don't like this.It's a fun and addictive game! :D 10/10 would gem again (and the female characters are pretty sexy)
Match 4 until the end of times.

Not a bad game.   Pros: 1. The drawings are cute and the animation is fun to look at.  2. The heroes you get are pretty awesome. I gots me a vampire priestess, a dragon, a rogue, and some others too.  3. I enjoy the quests and challenges. Every one of them is a little harder.  and  4. I like the whole guild thing. This really has some potential to it as players should be able to help other players too.   Cons:  1. It does have a P2W quality to it. I chipped in 5 bucks and got various stuff's but I can already tell it's going to be one of THOSE games. You know. Pay out more for more goodies.  2. It's luck based. It feels more like Match 3 poker than it does anything else. This fighting mechanic can become grusome esp. during a boss fight. If it draws 3 skulls, sometimes that is all it needs to win. I have lost a lot of battles due to just not 'drawing' what I needed at the time.  and  3. Probably my least amount of concern goes to the generic soundtrack. I suggest Spotify or Youtube whilst playing.   Overall, not a bad game. It has decent mechanics and even though it's solely luck based..it's not the worst game in the world. I wish it had a little better graphic system, but the cute sprites are fun to look at netherless. I'm impressed with how the game works, on most ends, and will be playing this some more. :)

Not a bad game.   Pros: 1. The drawings are cute and the animation is fun to look at.  2. The heroes you get are pretty awesome. I gots me a vampire priestess, a dragon, a rogue, and some others too.  3. I enjoy the quests and challenges. Every one of them is a little harder.  and  4. I like the whole guild thing. This really has some potential to it as players should be able to help other players too.   Cons:  1. It does have a P2W quality to it. I chipped in 5 bucks and got various stuff's but I can already tell it's going to be one of THOSE games. You know. Pay out more for more goodies.  2. It's luck based. It feels more like Match 3 poker than it does anything else. This fighting mechanic can become grusome esp. during a boss fight. If it draws 3 skulls, sometimes that is all it needs to win. I have lost a lot of battles due to just not 'drawing' what I needed at the time.  and  3. Probably my least amount of concern goes to the generic soundtrack. I suggest Spotify or Youtube whilst playing.   Overall, not a bad game. It has decent mechanics and even though it's solely luck based..it's not the worst game in the world. I wish it had a little better graphic system, but the cute sprites are fun to look at netherless. I'm impressed with how the game works, on most ends, and will be playing this some more. :)

Beware! This game is quite addicting (for me). It's easy to learn and very fun! There are times when it feels that the A.I is a little too hard and that the recommended move from the computer is a trap but all in all it's a game to simply enjoy. The updates seem to affect the different troops that you can obtain which was extremely annoying, I had one that was at level 10 when suddenly the next day it was at level 8 and then down to level 1 leaving me with what once was a beast troop but now a more wimpy one. But I still highly recommend this game to any kind of gamer looking for a good time.
Pay to win grindfest. I hate this game.

PROS: - Beautiful game, the artwork is really stunning! - RPG elements are made really well. You are not just matching 3 gems, you are invading kingdoms, saving princesses, salying dragons. You can customize your hero as you wish. - Great variety of Kingdoms/Classes/Troops/Weapons - You can join a guild - the multiplayer element is nice since the collective efforts of everyone in the guild helps develope your character. - There is PVP system (yes it is that much of a big deal for me)  CONS: - Too much grind! To be a leading player you need at least 8 hour per day (yeah and no1 is paying you for this); - The PVP systems is good, but is a one-sided mode. You can only attack. When you've been attacked the AI is doing the battle instead of you. This game needs online mode for PVP battles! - Money is a factor - you can go from scrubs to champ in a night if you have money! Yeah, yeah F2P games need some kind of pay-to-win system, but in this game it is really deffinitive for winning pvp battles!

Good solid game. Similarities with Puzzle Quest buts offers richer character and team modiication but lacks the RPG elements of exploring locations that the PQ2 offered. That said, I think the depth and difficulty is perfect and will keep you engaged a lot longer than you originally planned.

Good solid game. Similarities with Puzzle Quest buts offers richer character and team modiication but lacks the RPG elements of exploring locations that the PQ2 offered. That said, I think the depth and difficulty is perfect and will keep you engaged a lot longer than you originally planned.

Game is EXCELLENT.  1. Maybe the BEST score of any game ever. the music is simply incredible.  2. EPIC RPG/Card Game style gem-matching mashup game play. this is as DEEP as a puzzle game could possibly get!  3. Seemingly endless content, and they're always putting out new stuff.  and 4. You can be successful at this game, while remaining 100% free to play!  they should just take donations, because this game is so worth!

The layout of the game is a fusion between Puzzle Quest and a digital CCG...Or TCG...I don't know, I don't play those things. Unlike MPQ, it's a little more interesting...Maybe it's becaues it's not a product of banking on Comic Book Nerds...But, there's a downside, LIKE MPQ, it's just something to play whenever you get bored...But after a few battles, that's pretty much enough...Until you get bored again...I personally didn't enjoy it for very long, but maybe YOU will.

This game`s interesting. Mix a type of game with others and I like that. In this game u can up levels so fast and the battles are exciting. This game fill only a little bit of MB in your pc and is so funny to play it. In my opinion this is the type of game that must be in all of your libraries. :)
I really enjoy playing this game! :)
I find this game fun, but something is off. I don't know what it is, but something needs to be changed. 6/10
Fun, quick and inexpensive game that is easy to learn to play. It's worth it to buy the starter pack for 5 dollars.  It also has a sense of empire building though it is very basic.
absulutely brilliant takes a while to get in to but when you do youll realise that its not just a match 3 game you have to think about your moves the more you play the better it gets

I did have negative impressions at first but the game seems balanced now. They really listen to player to improve experience.   I can play 1 hour everyday without getting bored. And ingame currencies like glory, key and gold became easily obtainable.  I recommend to join a guild and use all the bonuses. Good job Infinity Team.

From what I've seen. Its another typical match 3in a row or higher type puzzle game. But this go around, you use your matches to activate abilites for each of your characters during a battle. Its pretty fun and colorful and I'd give it a 7/10.

YES, I RECOMMEND THIS GAME M8 any way this has to be one of my favourite games i have most of the troops plus i own a guild (if you want to join, add me and msg your invite code)  Only problem crashes alot AND THE SCREEN MINIMIZEZ if it did that and i could still play and the last enemy  would not be killable but i have scarlett in my team and ragnagord 1337/1337 would use ragnagord  or shut down lol w78 it would exit da battle... fail

I really like the unique idea of mixing match-3 and action 'card' game with RPG elements. Fights are quite short, always different and most importantly fun, even after playing hundreds of them. It is a shame that especially with the latest update, you have to spend some money or A LOT of time in order to remain being competitive in PVP. Even though, if you enjoy playing match-3s, it can bring you many hours of fun.
Its nice and addictive.. But The AI is OP'd always.. Would be nice if the chance to get an Epic or a Legendary Card is higher with Keys..

As annoying as the free-to-play crap is, this game is the first match-3 battler I've played that really feels like a worthy successor to the original Puzzle Quest. At least it seems to have a way less awful buy-in scheme than Marvel: Puzzle Quest did --you can get a bunch of Legendary allies just from doing the story, and I've pulled some pretty a'ight ultra-rares from the free keys you occasionally get.  Good times.

My husband introduced me to this on XBox One. It's just as addictive as Bejeweled. In fact, it's like a cross between Bejeweled and Magic: The Gathering. All of the puzzles are in versus mode, so you have to be careful about setting up shots for your opponent. (I can be terrible about that.) You can level all of your cards/characters up as you see fit, though. There is a quest/storyline, but you get to choose which kingdoms to unlock. Completing all challenges and other requirements will level up a kingdom as well, though I haven't seen how that plays a part in things yet.  Fair warning, this game does have the option to buy things with real money. It's fairly minimal compared to most games, thankfully. While you can buy useful items and packages, it's not full of micro-transactions like Candy Crush or Frozen.
You tried to stop after midnight but failed. You tried again after 2 am but failed again. You tried AGAIN after 5 am but failed. Suddenly it's noon and then you stop... or did you.
Fun and highly addictive,one of the best free to play games I've come across in a long time,if you liked any of the puzzle quest games you'll for sure enoy this.

I have seen this gem of a game grow up from near the begining, when there were no defense rewards, no end of the week rank awards, diffrent guilds, about half as many places as there are now and certanly no treasure maps or arena and no asccending troops, I remeber when it was just starting off. Most games when somebody thinks about the older version its to see how much better it was back then, not for this game, this game just keeps on getting better and better and a steady pace.  This is one of my favorite games to sit down when i have some free time, or a long loading screen, and play a match, collect my gold or to do a treaure hunt. Each place has its own fun story and there a tons of creatures to collect and many diffrent combinations to try.

This game is another match game with pve and pvp (tho the computer seems to run your defense and it takes some practice and guesswork to find troops which the computer is compentent with on defense giving decent players a good 20 or so level edge) you dont need to spend money on gems..the basic currency as the best items are earned from glory which you get from conquring lands in pvp the better your rating thruout the week the more you earn each day Glory allow you to purchase the weekly special weapon or troop usually well worthwhile at least if it matches your colors and style of play about the only thing I might reccomend buying crystals to spend on would be either a costume which can give you a permanent bonus to gold, xp, souls but only from each fight ( I went for souls as you use alot to train your troops up towards the level 18 cap), or more keys at the very beginning these grant you extra rare and beyond troops allowing you a better idea of a good offense/defense. In addition joining an active guild gains you a gem bonus plus you share in any tasks completed with gold by the guild granting such items as: treasure maps, keys, gems, and souls

It gets kind of adicting and everyone is so nice
I find it to be a very fun puzzle game.

This is the spiritial successor to Puzzle Quest and it takes that formula and runs with it. It adds cards, differnt ways to power up your skills, and a seamless blend of multi-player and single. Every week there is new content being added in the way of cards and sometimes a new area. The developers are involved and always seem to be tweaking the game. The only part I dislike is that while you can play the same profile on mobile or PC, you cannot do that with the PS4 or Xbox One versions. I recomend this game to people frequently and it is constantly on my playlist. Richards out until Harambe's out.

Fun little game, nice concept, nice art.   BUT.  Besides the fact that the reward is half as much as you have to pay to fight a battle, this game has the  worst. cheating. AI. EVER.  The AI always gets the extra turns, always gets the skulls, always gets a great combination of gems and/ or skulls just as it's about to lose and turns the tide of the battle. Always.  One of the best examples I came across: I was just about to win a battle the enemy had one card with I dunno 3 health? it plays one random row of 3 gems, and all of a sudden the new gems that came on screen gave it 4 extra turns and twice 4 skulls. It destroyed all three of my cards with one move. For crying out loud FIX THIS.  Until then it's recommended, give it a try, but at the same time, no I don't recommend it. It will only ♥♥♥♥ you off.

seriously this game may be free and all. but ♥♥♥♥ it. the dumbest ♥♥♥♥ will happen to you all the time. new gems drop in and your god damn opponant will get 6 ♥♥♥♥ing extra turns. ♥♥♥♥ this stupid ♥♥♥ game

So lets start with the basic : this game is a Facebook/Hearthstone/Battleon Fail  You have the Hero and 3 more minions that have spells witch you can upgrade later with gems The beginners problem is you pay more gold for quests then you get back. I had no paicence to try till arena to see what happends but if you login daily and join guild you should be fine.  The ideea of the game is good but poor made. The ideea to p2w is right there i played PVP i had like 10 hp to my creeps the other guy killed all my stuff in 2 spells so 0 balance , only if you buy and upgrade ur stuff.  Its a fun game , fast but very repetitive , every time same backround same mobs same sounds.  PS : AI CHEATS if you dont have MEGA LUCK they will crush you!  You beg to god for 3skulls , that will never happen when you move something you give AI free atack When they move u have 0 chance to make something.  6/10 - my choice good game but P2W destroyed it. Peace  I will continue to play casual only because Achievements

Game made by greedy people. If you are not donating you can not play with a joy. It's just hilarious how game is helping to the computer in challanges and how less gold you get every day (you need to wait the whole day to play 1-2h at the beggining). You can not buy cards or anything. You need to pray for a key which might be given to you by random power. Annoying and pathetic. Game makers goal is to get real money than to give a game which is pleasent and delightful for gamers society.

This game is so broken, even when you play with the maximum concentration the enemy will very often find help from the gems that fall down in the right place.  The curve of level up of the cards is too much steep, at level 5 most of the cards will need 100 souls to level up, that is a level 5 challenge rewards, no worth... And at the 3rd or 4th kingdom you'll find enemy with cards at level 10+ that will destroy you. The music after 1 hour will annoy you.  If I should save something, is... well, I was going to say the drawings, but they are not so new. I mean, you can find everywhere this kind of art. It's a pity, the idea is not so bad

The Game itself is actually quite fun to play but the AI is just ridiculous. They don't make any Faults at all and play everything 100% Perfect.  As a lot of Guys already said.. the AI always gets the Skulls, always gets the Combos and whatnot.

I understand why a game should provide challenges. Victory is meaningless without them. Outmaneuvering a game like this can be immensely satisfying and well worth your efforts. On the other end of the spectrum, constantly losing a game - any game - that overwhelms you with unecessarily difficult or next-to-impossible challenges quickly becomes frustrating, if not infuriating, and that's what's going on in Gems of War. ft doesn't take long for you to realize that the developers are in total control of every outcome of every match you play here, that random number generators, luck and skill have nothing whatsoever to do with the experience. No matter what you do, how many guilds you join, how often you allow them to post to your Facebook page, or how many dollars you throw at this game to embellish your troops or your main character, once you reach the advanced level of the game, you will not win. Gems of War doesn't want to challenge you. It wants to make you angry, and at that it truly succeeds.  Play this game long enough and you'll see for yourself: at a certain point, the AI literally takes control of the match and gives itself 6 turns in a row to your every 1. Super powered monsters come out of their respective lairs and blow your characters to smithereens leaving you sitting there slack jawed and stunned, with nothing to show for your efforts. Blatantly rigging a game in this manner is audacious and mean spirited, not to mention just plain stupid. There's not even any attempt to make it appear as though you lost the match fair and square. The end result: every reason you may have ever had for playing Gems of War is obliterated. No wonder it's free. Delete it off your hard drive and never look back.
nice game till lvl 25 .... after that i`m sure that game is cheating... comp opponent has 3 time more 'mana surge' then i and he has 2x more 4 game in a row then i ...
Could be just my luck, but 95% of battles are just locking for me, without 'press to continue' prompt. Was really lucky to win tutorial, in around 5 sittings.

Unbalanced game. Until level 25 is game more-less without problem, as well as during invasion or defend against invasion. Problem appears when you play against AI. During AI turn is not rare 5-6 consecutive 4 or 5 gems matching, direct attacks matching skulls etc. Random attack was ussually directed to most active or the strongest member of group..... I do not want to tell that it was cheating...., is polite to say that game is unbalanced. Three - four games like this and gamers could be deter from playing games. I prefer to pay for game and buy balanced and finished game....

This is a game where they simply got the underyling difficulty wrong before we even get into any of the other issues. This game is predicated on two extremely broken concepts:  1. The person who moves first in this game (which is you) has an overwhelming advantage in a short game. 2. The AI is overwhelmingly stronger than most players in a long game.  So you start your game and you're easily able to leverage your first move advantage and beating the AI down easily, and you think this is a fair game for a F2P or that you're just so awesome at this game. Then, eventually the game gets longer as AI comes with more complete teams + higher level teams with HP values your team can't touch. Since the AI pretty much never evaluates a match 4/5 or a skull situation wrong, eventually you're going to make a bad move and watch the AI merciless pound your guys to oblivion. Now this is where most reviews will claim the game is P2W or the AI is cheating. But it's not that. Even if you spent hundreds of dollars on the game your slightly stronger team will still get pounded horribly whenever you make a mistake, but if you got enough money on your guys you might be able to withstand the barrage. Of course, for those who aren't big spenders you'll simply lose and run out of your gold. You can try again or grind some more but overall it doesn't change the fact that as games drag on, you'll simply be beaten by AI's flawless evaluation of the key scenarios, and evaluating those scenarios correctly determines the winner about 90% of the time.  Of course, the lack of information on your cards from an in game source makes any attempt to put together a team a wild guess at best. There are skills that reads like 'does 2 + damage based on number of reds'. How much damage? You don't know unless you check a forum for a guy who has worked out the math. So you face a significant deficit and you don't even necessarily know how your skills will work. Can you expect this guy to be able to tank or that guy to be able to do damage at level 10? Better check a guide elsewhere, because this information isn't available in the game short of leveling the character up yourself, and there's no way you can afford to do that just as an experiment.  I suspect if you spent enough time/money on the game you'll eventually reach some kind of equilibrium where you have enough high level characters with enough cheap skills to reduce the average game to a length short enough to be even, but I don't know why anyone should be expected to put up with the abuse on the way getting there. The game by design is meant to hurt and I guess you win when you can overcome the beating. Or you can just not play the game.

This game is fun but only if you invest a fortune of real life money in it. IT IS THE VERY DEFINITION OF PAY TO WIN. My experience with this game is as follows: I liked the quests, they were fun and had a lot of thought behind it, the themes matched perfectly and they can be challenging at times. Unfortunetly they cost more gems than they offer and there is no way to farm gold no matter how well you play since the winnings are capped. There is a way to 'invade' other players and win gold that way but the matchmaking is abhorrent since I constantly get matched with players 20 or more levels above me. How can a lvl 18 copete with a level 35+. Your opponent is permanently luckyer than you. Its an uphill struggle that you cant win unless you throw money at it. DON'T PLAY THIS GAME unless you really like to feel cheated.

Typical facebook paytowin. Match 3 vs insanly lucky and pretty stupid AI.  Could be ok, if not insane troop lvl costs, wich give pretty unbalanced chances of double turn effectivness.  Not worth playing without pvp. Fist purchase for 5$ or smth includes every1 you need to get top rank guild. Wich is stiil easy achivable without donate, just everyday logging + getting event rewards. And thats all, no way forward no matter, how good are you. Meeting guys with 100% double mana and ton of max lvl ultra-rare collectables turn games into random only matters braindead stuff.
UI screams IOS, massive paywall past the first couple hours, cartoonish and childish story and characters.

This game is pretty boring and doesn't have a lot of staying power.  I think this genre would probably be best as a mobile app, but there's no way I could spend more than 10 minutes playing it without getting bored.

I dislike having to wait on gold(energy like in other f2p games) just so i can play the game. 2 hours in, got to level 10 and I'm out of gold with only losing 2 campaign matches and an Invade(pvp) match the game instructed me to try. The game looks nice and I like the added gameplay to the Puzzle Quest style gameplay but forcing me to wait to play the game is annoying. Of course unless I wanted to pay cash I can just keep playing until my wallet is dry.

This is one of those blatent Free-To-Play aka Pay-Tp-Play games that absolutely SCREAM going to the Store to buy more Gold, which you have to pay to actually unlock any battle, any new town, any game feature. Yes, I HAVE seen Free-To-Play that asks you to buy using real money, but the game itself was so damn much fun, totally separate from being Free-To-Play, and yet the ingame purchases were cheap and reasonable, and NOT ABSOLUTELY NECESSARY, that I would feel pretty goodm throwning the developers a few extra dollars, but this is not one of them. Make this game non-Free-To-Play and charge a few dollars for it, and that would be reasonable. But as it is now, STAY AWAY!  OH, and I almost never even bother installing Free-Ro-Play games, and I absolutely HATE the damn F2P model that current colsole games seem to revel in these days to boot!

Having played long enough to reach level 97 I feel ready to review this game. This is a simple match 3 game with difficulty stacked on top... The 'Move Advisor' that is a part of the game will on average help your AI controlled opponent much more than you (why here's an easy match... now opponent moves and wow look at that... 36 consecutive matches which were only possible because you made the dumbest move possible). The game has been lacking in fun for many levels, with the knowledge that 'I'm winning' is fun and 'that peating sheice of chit is beating the tar out of me' is not fun, made worse by the AI helping itself more than it would ever help you.  Add on top of that a game update which has made the game unplayable... can't connect to server... can't connect to server... can't connect to server... You might think a little test playing before release of a game update but hey.... Why test it in alpha when we can wreck the game in beta?

This is a game that could be much better but so much of it becomes very one sided and just gruelling. You will be in battle where the enemy will chain hea faster than you can deal damage. You then spend time re-organising your team but then you realise most are still level 1 and so it takes more time to try and build them up and it goes on and on and on. Clearly the design is for you to buy soul gems and then boost them up. I really am very tired of pay to win games. I mean you do not need to pay a dime but you will spend decades playing to get anywhere but super frustrated. I would much rather pay for the game and play it with balanced mechanics.  It is a game to play for a bit and walk away as it gets frustrating very fast or pay vast amounts of money, which you could have used to buy better stand alone games.
i can not delete my character and creat a new one.

There is NOTHING to recommend here. Move along. Gems have been sold away for P2W game.  The Gameplay, visuals and pretty much anything that COULD'VE been entertaining is DOA. You have to pay STUPIDLY large sums of Gold to PvP battle people. Both players pay gold and one wins it all. Sounds interesting yeah? WRONG! Match making is broken and will que you up against Level 40's and 50's while you're level 8. In order to get someone else, more your freakin' level you have to PAY to find another person. WTF. Why do I have to pay just to actually have fair matchmaking? Heck, even when I DO PAY, I can still get a person of an even HIGHER level.  Then on TOP of all of that, for EVERY. SINGLE. CAMPAIGN MISSION YOU MUST PAY IN GOLD! You Pay to unlock areas. You pay to play missions. You pay to PvP. Pay, pay, pay. Seriously, there is more Paying in this game than in Dungeon Keeper Mobile by EA.  And it doesn't even count the P2W model of gameplay where you can not only pay for awesome cards but you can pay for awesome HERO weapons as well.  TL;DR, Stick with the better Puzzle Quest games and stay away from this utter Abomination of a game.  0/10 Needs more Pay to Win -IGN

This game is not bed the main problem is the AI. The AI play with cheating and dirty tricks not with inteligence: - Its very common On the whole table you have only one chooise so you do the steps that the AI want. - The AI can predict the unseen elements i saw that kind of combos that cant be done without massive foreseek And i can continue for day-s its not inteligence its cheating  Let me send a message to the creators: Please de a little work on the AI and dont be thes cheap because your game can be godd if you start to think at last

This game is Bejeweled where you're against an AI who will destroy you. all the time. most of this game is luck, not even in a good way. I've had so many times where there are 2 moves i can do: put their gun in my mouth so they cant miss, or stand still. Either I set my opponent up to easily hit me, or I waste my turn matching 3 gems I don't need. Then the AI goes, and because of your last move, they get an extra turn, then another, and another, and another...and their troops are all ready to kill yours.    This game does have -some- form of skill involved and feels like you can control whether or not you win, but no. the gems off screen fall in to help the AI more than they will help you.    I would only recommend if you are really into Bejeweled (also theres an odd Hearthstone feel to the game, such as the ranking system). Or maybe you just like losing. Yeah. Play this game if you like losing to AI.

Well there is totally no strategy possible! You Can only hope that the game will be on your side. And if not it makes you waste the soo precious coin you need to play the game. If you run out you need to wait tomorow to play.

Don't play this game. Everything is this game is utter nonsense. For example if you get 4 gems in a row, you get an extra turn. But just now I did that but no extra turn, and after that AI spam 4 gems with the stupid ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ game dev thinking its funny to build the system to drop gems of the same color next to one another for the AIs. Please Devs, if you are so ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ to build ♥♥♥♥♥♥ AIs, DONT EVEN ♥♥♥♥ING MAKE A GAME IN THE FIRST PLACE. Helping them win in a stupid manner? Go ♥♥♥♥ yourself. Marvel has a better puzzle game than this crap. Although nothing beats Puzzle Fighters.  *I did partially blame luck but please take note that it happens WAY TOO OFTEN!* (more like every match after the starting stage)

This game was recomended to me by my friend, as a very good f2p puzzle quest with multiplayer option. After only a few hours I am highly dissapointed. The game is f2p only by the name, if you want to play and have fun you are forced to play.   If you want to start a fight in 'Gems of War' you need to pay 50 gold (in game currency). But, for every won fight you get... around 10 gold. After a few fights my character didn't have anymore gold and I had to stop playing. Ofcourse, game provides player with daily gold but it amount is as low as for the won fight. So, basiclly, if you want to play more that 3 games a day you are forced to buy in game gold for real money.  Also, the pvp matching is horribly unbalanced. My character, below lvl 10, was matched against characters over 30 lvl. Pvp also cost gold fee for entering, which is way bigger that normal fight and if you loose... you loose almost all your gold.  The game itself IS nice and fun. Graphics are simple but nice, music and sounds are okey, it is fun to lvl up your troops and giving your character masteries points... but you actually can't do it, cause you can't fight... and can't get lvl, troops, masteries.
Pay to win. BB

Sorry to say, but I've been using steam for a really long time and it's the first time I find a game that's so terrible that I need to post a review about this experience. This game has no grind feature, and makes it impossible for people to progress. The AI is clearly not honest. This game is just a pay-to-progress, and is not worth the time. Animations between fights are terrible and completely useless, definitely a no for me. Uninstalling.

Alright, so if your quick to anger or easily angered like I am, or want to feel/like being the person who wins in games, I do not recommend this game at all. I'm not a sore loser, I know when it was a good game and the person who wins should be praised. But this game is totally not on your side, least not on mine. They have a money trap going on, they make you spend more coins then you get to start a battle. Then not to mention when you level up you only get on point, and if you use souls to level up your army the same thing happens. I used 55 souls and I got one defence, I should of at least got one of each, and souls are not easy to come by. Now if you want to do a PVP fight, well you better be in the level twenties. Thats mainly who they will set you up with, then you basically just get the same gold you just spent out. This game was so not worth it to me, least its free though. Makes me happy I didn't waste my money on getting angry when I could of done it for free by getting on facebook.
tl;dr:  I recommend this game, if you plan to pay for it. If you want a real f2p game, go look somewhere else.
too much boring, and worst gameplay

Well the time has nearly come for me to STOP playing this game , it USED to be a great game the little things they have added here and there were a slow-coming halt to the players that have invested lots of time... ive been playing this game since it came out.. i log in nearly every day at the VERY least.. have nearly all creatures and about 1/2 of the weapons you can get .. all the achievements .... Now you can buy pretty much everything you want for money now.. including trait skills and added traits to creatures i have to say is a huge flop.. it lets other people take creatues that are already broken and make them rediculous...btw keeping in mind that i have saved up my gems for a 50 gem armor to get more of a bonus per fight and so forth.. and my character is only level 158... ive been playing since day one btw... and i play against level 300-400 people.. which is like... REALLY? so unless they make some kind of change to this game.. dont invest your money or time into it.. its literally ALL pay to WIN now.. even the most hardcore of players have trouble playing game i would opinionate... its hard for me to even get past rank 5 .. or get to rank 1.. nearly every week.. to reap the rewards... is it even worth it..im not sure anymore.. all i can say .. is i am getting tired of this game.. DEVELOPERS IF YOUR READING THIS.. YOU NEED TO NERF SOME STUFF.. and RULE OUT some of the pay to WIN stuff.. seriously most of your following of this game is Free to play people.. and those are the people keeping this game AFLOAT.. eliminate those.. and your paying people will have noone to play against.. because the crowd... that has already been diminishing.. is going to completely abandon this game soon.

Not appropriate for young children.  There are veiled references to torture (specifically the Dark Master who spawns Thralls which have a Suffering state shown as tearing eyes). When I saw this, I felt they had crossed a line of good judgement in the artwork. And I understand there's a market for this sort of artwork and it's very similar to DnD style. I can't in good conscience endorse the sort of 'surprise!' experience from a more light-hearted introduction in the cover art and first steps playing, to the darker elements.  If you're going to go that far into a dark S+M artwork style, at least try to reflect it in the game's cover art that this might not be agreeable to all parents for their children playing.  This is especially surprising when the other games from Infinite Interactive do look like they are targeting a younger audience.  Also personally, even though I own the DnD genre of games (Baldur's Gate comes to mind) - I don't appreciate when a game goes that far into the dark style, and I tend to give up on the game upon recognizing it. It just doesn't appeal to me. Maybe because there are real people who do experience torture and I don't find any enjoyment or entertainment value whatsoever in finding references to torture in games.  Sorry. Otherwise I liked the game mechanics.

Guys avoid this game like the plague the AI is rigged, its like playing against a supercomputer as soon as you go past lvl 15 the AI will chain combo you endlessly its almost impossible to beat him. The game dev have done this on purpose to tempt free players to buy gems, avoid this game you won't regret it. Its a shame ps4 allows these type of developers on their platform.  Its just not the AI the issue, i will explain : things such as new line gems appearing and which give the AI perfect chain combos i mean i am talking about 5x combo chained automatically when the new row falls down this is the best part the AI did not have to even do anything the game gave him free combos. The dev claims its 50/50 when several players have discovered the same things , the game has an edge of the player at all times. I wouldn't mind if the AI being smart but when the game mechanics includes the other elements i have mentionned you not even fair ground match, its like playing poker and your opponents keeps having royal flush or straight flush.
(This will contain no information and purely a negative or positive recommendation) Personal Rating: 1.5/5
